title: Contending for the Faith
shortSummary: The Epistle of Jude warns believers against false teachers who have infiltrated the church, urging Christians to defend the faith once delivered to the saints. It exhorts the faithful to remain steadfast in love, prayer, and holiness while looking forward to Christ’s mercy and eternal life.
timeline: c. AD 65-80 - Early Christian Church, post-resurrection period

keyCharacters.name: Jude
keyCharacters.description: The author of the epistle, servant of Jesus Christ and brother of James, writing to encourage believers to defend the faith.

keyCharacters.name: Michael the Archangel
keyCharacters.description: A chief angel who contended with the devil over the body of Moses, demonstrating spiritual authority and restraint.

keyCharacters.name: False Teachers
keyCharacters.description: Ungodly men who secretly infiltrate the church, turning God’s grace into licentiousness and denying Jesus Christ.

keyCharacters.name: Enoch
keyCharacters.description: The seventh from Adam who prophesied about the Lord’s coming judgment on the ungodly.

definitions.definition: Excessive or offensive sexual desire; unrestrained lustfulness, which false teachers misuse God’s grace to justify.
To vigorously defend and uphold the true Christian doctrine against error and false teaching.
Those who complain or grumble against God’s will or authority, often undermining unity and faith.
A phrase describing eternal condemnation and separation from God reserved for the ungodly.

outline.heading: Greeting and Purpose
outline.description: Jude introduces himself and addresses the sanctified believers, emphasizing the necessity to earnestly contend for the faith once delivered to the saints.

outline.heading: Warning Against False Teachers
outline.description: Jude exposes the character and judgment of false teachers who have infiltrated the church, using Old Testament examples and vivid imagery to highlight their destructive influence.

outline.heading: Exhortation to Believers
outline.description: Believers are urged to remember the apostles’ warnings, build themselves up in faith, pray in the Holy Spirit, and show mercy while rescuing others from sin.

outline.heading: Doxology
outline.description: Jude closes with a powerful doxology praising God’s ability to keep believers from falling and present them faultless with exceeding joy.

application: Be vigilant in defending the true gospel and reject any teaching that distorts God’s grace or denies Christ’s lordship.
Build your spiritual life through prayer, faith, and reliance on the Holy Spirit to remain steadfast against falsehood.
Show compassion to those led astray, seeking to restore them gently while maintaining holiness in your own walk.
Trust in God’s power to preserve you from falling and to present you blameless before His glorious presence.

keyVerses.text: Beloved, when I gave all diligence to write unto you of the common salvation, it was needful for me to write unto you, and exhort you that ye should earnestly contend for the faith which was once delivered unto the saints.
keyVerses.significance: This verse highlights the urgent call to defend the true Christian faith against false teachers.

keyVerses.text: Now unto him that is able to keep you from falling, and to present you faultless before the presence of his glory with exceeding joy,
keyVerses.significance: A powerful reminder of God’s sustaining grace and the ultimate hope of being presented blameless before Him.

keyVerses.text: To the only wise God our Saviour, be glory and majesty, dominion and power, both now and ever. Amen.
keyVerses.significance: This doxology praises God’s eternal wisdom and sovereignty, affirming His role as Savior.

keyVerses.text: But ye, beloved, building up yourselves on your most holy faith, praying in the Holy Ghost, Keep yourselves in the love of God, looking for the mercy of our Lord Jesus Christ unto eternal life.
keyVerses.significance: Encourages believers to actively nurture their faith and remain anchored in God’s love and hope.
